Pre-Game Insights: Detroit is currently a more ambitious and more competitive team than Charlotte.
Both face-to-face meetings in the current championship ended in victories for the Hornets, which, however, makes the Pistons an even bigger favourite in the upcoming game.
It'll be interesting to see if Bickerstaff's team can pull off a 0:3 loss in this series, given the difference in class.
We're going for Detroit and the total under. Firstly, Charlotte's offense isn't the strongest, and secondly, the Pistons lost their main scorer Jaden Ivey to injury.
We're also betting on Detroit for assists.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pistons have had a great season under their new coach, J.B. Bickerstaff.
The team's defence has improved a lot, letting in an average of 114.6 points per game compared to 119 last season.
Their offense has also got better, with the team scoring 112 points per game, up from 109.9 last season.
Cade Cunningham, the No. 1 pick in the 2021 draft, has also improved.
Charlotte's defense is ranked 16th in the league, with an average passer rating of 112.8 points per game, but on offence they're 29-and-over with 106.2 points scored per game.
Before the matchup with Detroit, the Hornets had failed eight straight games.
The Hornets had played the last two games at home, first losing to Oklahoma (94:106) and then failing to handle Chicago (108:115 (98:98) in overtime).
The odds for Detroit are 1,91, for TU (216.5) is 1,91, for H1 (-6.5) is 1,87, and for Assists H1 (-1.5) is 1,72.
